}} The 'Biographical Dictionary of the Extreme Right Since 1890' is a reference
book by Philip Rees, on leading people in the various far right movements since
1890. It contains entries for what the author regards as "the 500 major figures
on the radical right, extreme right, and revolutionary right from 1890 to the
present" (publisher's blurb). It was published, as a 418-page hardcover, in New
York by Simon & Schuster in 1990 (ISBN 0-13-089301-3).

In the introduction Rees discusses his criterion for inclusion in the book. He
describes the extreme right as "opposed to parliamentary forms of democratic
representation and hostile to pluralism."(xvii) Among those it covers are
Argentinian nationalists, Mexican [[sinarquistas]], American [[Nativism
(politics)|nativist]] [[demagogue]]s, Brazilian [[Integralists]], German
[[Nazism|National Socialists]], Portuguese [[National Syndicalists]], Spanish
[[Falangists]], and Belgian [[Rexists]].
